item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description:
My observation, the 3 primary reasons someone isn't getting healed in a battleground:
1. He/she is not protecting the healer. 2. He/she is being a bag of douche. (No heals for you! Come back, one year!) or 3. Shit has just happened.
There's also 4. The healer in question is one of "those" paladins, you know the kind I mean. Swinging their hammer around in the air instead of popping a few heals on the rogue-buzzsaw who's desperately trying to save his paladin ass.
That 4th one is open for argument, however.

item.title: By: Zax
item.dc:creator: Zax
item.description:
Had a warlock scream at me once (a druid) for casting moonfire on a rogue kicking his butt. Apparently, he was trying to seduce the guy, and my moonfire broke it. Nevermind that immediately after I popped the moonfire, I healed him like he had never been healed.
It was amazing. And, he never got healed again.

item.title: By: gesikah
item.dc:creator: gesikah
item.description:
It doesn't take nearly that much for me to stop healing someone. Heals are a privilege, not a right.
Seems like all healers can be put in two catagories: those who feel duty-bound to heal everyone and those that feel duty-bound to teach people to lrn2play. I fall in the latter. Those of us in the latter have tried repeatedly to explain it to those in the former,but rarely do they accept our teachings. If you heal them, they will never learn better behavior. The mage will still not control their aggro, the warlock will still Hellfire, then Lifetap himself down to 10 hps in the suppression room and then not bandage, the hunter will still not learn that kiting does not involve stopping to turning around to see if the target is still following. If people had not coddled them all this time, then we wouldn't having this problem NOW. Healing nubs 1-59 just means you are gonna have more smacktards at 60 than we do now.
